intro: Sonchus glandifera, commonly known as the glandular sowthistle, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster, with both ray and disk florets. Sonchus glandifera is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is considered an invasive species in some areas.
